concepts.concept_name: Classification of solids: amorphous and crystalline, unit cells, and crystal lattices
Packing efficiency and density calculations in cubic unit cells (scc, bcc, fcc/ccp, hcp)
Crystal defects: point defects (Schottky, Frenkel) and electrical properties

in_scope: Amorphous and crystalline solids, isotropy and anisotropy
Seven crystal systems and fourteen Bravais lattices
Unit cell: primitive and centred (bcc, fcc)
Number of atoms per unit cell, coordination number
Packing in solids: hcp, ccp, packing efficiency calculations
Voids: tetrahedral and octahedral
Density of unit cell calculations
Point defects: Schottky, Frenkel, interstitial, vacancy
Electrical properties: conductors, semiconductors (n-type, p-type), insulators
Magnetic properties: diamagnetic, paramagnetic, ferromagnetic
out_of_scope: X-ray diffraction and Bragg's equation derivations

concepts.concept_name: Concentration units, solubility, and Henry's law
Raoult's law, ideal and non-ideal solutions, and vapour pressure
Colligative properties: boiling point elevation, freezing point depression, osmotic pressure
Abnormal molar mass and van't Hoff factor

in_scope: Types of solutions and concentration terms (molarity, molality, mole fraction, mass percentage)
Solubility of gases: Henry's law and its applications
Vapour pressure of liquid solutions: Raoult's law
Ideal and non-ideal solutions, positive and negative deviations
Azeotropes and colligative properties
Relative lowering of vapour pressure
Elevation of boiling point and depression of freezing point
Osmotic pressure and reverse osmosis
Determination of molar mass using colligative properties
Abnormal molar mass: van't Hoff factor for association and dissociation
out_of_scope: Thermodynamics of mixing and excess functions
Phase rule applications beyond simple systems

concepts.concept_name: Electrochemical cells, electrode potentials, and the Nernst equation
Electrolysis, Faraday's laws, and conductance of electrolytic solutions
Batteries, fuel cells, and corrosion

in_scope: Galvanic cells: Daniel cell, cell notation, and EMF
Standard electrode potential and electrochemical series
Nernst equation and its applications
Relationship between Gibbs energy and cell potential (delta G = -nFE)
Conductance: specific, molar, and equivalent conductivity
Kohlrausch's law and its applications
Electrolysis and Faraday's first and second laws
Dry cell, lead storage battery, mercury cell, fuel cells
Corrosion as an electrochemical process and prevention methods
out_of_scope: Advanced fuel cell types and proton exchange membranes

concepts.concept_name: Rate of reaction, rate law, and order of reaction
Integrated rate equations for zero and first order reactions, half-life
Arrhenius equation, activation energy, and collision theory

in_scope: Rate of reaction: average and instantaneous rate
Factors affecting rate: concentration, temperature, catalyst
Rate law, rate constant, and molecularity vs order of reaction
Integrated rate equations: zero order and first order
Half-life for zero order and first order reactions
Pseudo first order reactions
Temperature dependence: Arrhenius equation (k = Ae^(-Ea/RT))
Activation energy and its determination from graphs
Collision theory of chemical reactions
out_of_scope: Second and higher order integrated rate laws in detail
Transition state theory and potential energy surfaces

concepts.concept_name: Adsorption: physisorption, chemisorption, adsorption isotherms
Colloids: classification, preparation, properties, and applications
Catalysis: homogeneous, heterogeneous, enzyme catalysis, and selectivity

in_scope: Adsorption vs absorption, physisorption vs chemisorption
Factors affecting adsorption, Freundlich adsorption isotherm
Catalysis: homogeneous and heterogeneous, activity and selectivity
Enzyme catalysis and its characteristics
Colloidal state: types (lyophilic, lyophobic, associated colloids)
Preparation and purification of colloids (dialysis, electrodialysis)
Properties: Tyndall effect, Brownian motion, electrophoresis, coagulation
Emulsions and their types
Applications of colloids in daily life and industry
out_of_scope: Langmuir and BET adsorption isotherms in mathematical detail

concepts.concept_name: Principles of extraction: concentration, reduction, and refining of ores
Thermodynamic and electrochemical principles of metallurgy (Ellingham diagram)
Extraction of aluminium, copper, zinc, and iron

in_scope: Occurrence of metals in nature: ores and minerals
Concentration of ores: gravity separation, magnetic separation, froth flotation, leaching
Extraction: calcination, roasting, smelting, flux, and slag
Thermodynamic principles: Ellingham diagrams for oxide reduction
Electrochemical principles of extraction
Refining methods: distillation, liquation, electrolytic refining, zone refining, vapour phase refining
Extraction of Al (Hall-Heroult), Cu, Zn, and Fe (blast furnace)
out_of_scope: Detailed industrial process engineering and plant design
Extraction of rare earth and precious metals

concepts.concept_name: Group 15: nitrogen family, ammonia, nitric acid, and oxides of nitrogen
Group 16: oxygen family, ozone, sulphuric acid, and oxoacids of sulphur
Group 17: halogens, interhalogen compounds, and oxoacids of halogens
Group 18: noble gases, compounds of xenon, and their structures

in_scope: Group 15: electronic configuration, oxidation states, allotropy of phosphorus
Preparation and properties of ammonia, nitric acid (Ostwald process)
Oxides of nitrogen: structures and properties
Phosphine, PCl3, PCl5, oxoacids of phosphorus
Group 16: allotropy of sulphur, ozone preparation and structure
Sulphuric acid (Contact process), oxoacids of sulphur
Group 17: preparation and properties of Cl2, HCl, interhalogen compounds
Oxoacids of halogens, bleaching powder, uses of halogens
Group 18: electronic configuration, compounds of xenon (XeF2, XeF4, XeF6), their shapes
out_of_scope: Advanced noble gas chemistry beyond xenon fluorides/oxides
Radioactive elements of p-block (Po, At) in detail

concepts.concept_name: Transition metals: electronic configuration, variable oxidation states, and general properties
Important compounds: KMnO4, K2Cr2O7 (preparation, properties, and structures)
Lanthanoids and actinoids: electronic configuration, oxidation states, and lanthanoid contraction

in_scope: General introduction to d-block: position in periodic table, electronic configuration
Characteristics: variable oxidation states, coloured ions, catalytic activity, magnetic properties
Formation of alloys and interstitial compounds
Ionization enthalpy, atomic and ionic radii trends in d-block
Preparation, properties, and structures of KMnO4 and K2Cr2O7
Lanthanoids: electronic configuration, oxidation states (+3 common), lanthanoid contraction
Actinoids: general features, comparison with lanthanoids
Uses of d-block and f-block elements
out_of_scope: Crystal field theory in mathematical detail (covered under coordination compounds)

concepts.concept_name: Werner's theory, IUPAC nomenclature, and isomerism in coordination compounds
Valence bond theory and crystal field theory for coordination compounds
Bonding, colour, magnetic properties, and stability of coordination compounds

in_scope: Werner's coordination theory: central metal, ligands, coordination number
IUPAC nomenclature of mononuclear coordination compounds
Isomerism: structural (ionisation, linkage) and stereoisomerism (geometrical, optical)
Bonding: VBT approach for octahedral, tetrahedral, square planar complexes
Crystal field theory: splitting in octahedral and tetrahedral fields
Crystal field stabilisation energy (CFSE)
Colour and magnetic properties of coordination compounds
Importance: biological systems (haemoglobin, chlorophyll), analytical chemistry, extraction
out_of_scope: Molecular orbital theory for coordination compounds
Jahn-Teller distortions and advanced spectral analysis
Kinetics and mechanisms of ligand substitution reactions

concepts.concept_name: Nomenclature, preparation methods, and physical properties of haloalkanes and haloarenes
Nucleophilic substitution reactions (SN1, SN2) and elimination reactions
Reactions of haloarenes and polyhalogen compounds (CHCl3, CCl4, DDT, freons)

in_scope: Classification and IUPAC nomenclature of haloalkanes and haloarenes
Nature of C-X bond and physical properties
Preparation from alcohols, alkenes, and by halogen exchange (Finkelstein, Swarts)
SN1 and SN2 mechanisms, stereochemical aspects (Walden inversion, racemisation)
Elimination reactions (dehydrohalogenation) and Saytzeff rule
Reactions with metals: Wurtz reaction, Grignard reagents
Haloarenes: electrophilic substitution (directing effects of halogens), Dow process
Stability of haloarenes due to resonance
Polyhalogen compounds: chloroform, carbon tetrachloride, freons, DDT

concepts.concept_name: Nomenclature, preparation, and reactions of alcohols (primary, secondary, tertiary)
Phenols: acidity, preparation, electrophilic substitution, and Reimer-Tiemann reaction
Ethers: preparation by Williamson synthesis, reactions, and electrophilic substitution of anisole

in_scope: Classification and IUPAC nomenclature of alcohols, phenols, ethers
Preparation of alcohols: hydration of alkenes, Grignard reagents, reduction of carbonyls
Reactions of alcohols: dehydration, oxidation, esterification, reaction with HX (Lucas test)
Distinction between primary, secondary, and tertiary alcohols
Phenols: preparation (from cumene, diazonium salts), acidity, comparison with alcohols
Electrophilic substitution of phenols: nitration, halogenation, Kolbe and Reimer-Tiemann reactions
Ethers: preparation (Williamson synthesis), cleavage by HI
Electrophilic substitution of anisole
out_of_scope: Detailed industrial manufacturing of methanol and ethanol

concepts.concept_name: Nomenclature, preparation, and nucleophilic addition reactions of aldehydes and ketones
Aldol condensation, Cannizzaro reaction, and oxidation reactions
Carboxylic acids: acidity, preparation, and reactions (esterification, Hell-Volhard-Zelinsky)

in_scope: IUPAC nomenclature and structures of aldehydes, ketones, carboxylic acids
Preparation of aldehydes and ketones: oxidation of alcohols, ozonolysis, acyl chloride reduction
Nucleophilic addition: addition of HCN, NaHSO3, Grignard reagents, alcohols (acetal formation)
Reactions with NH2-derivatives: oximes, hydrazones, semicarbazones
Aldol condensation, cross aldol condensation
Cannizzaro reaction, Clemmensen and Wolff-Kishner reductions
Oxidation: Tollens' test, Fehling's test, chromic acid
Carboxylic acids: preparation, acidity and factors affecting it
Reactions: esterification (Fischer), reduction, Hell-Volhard-Zelinsky reaction
Acyl chlorides, anhydrides, esters, amides formation
out_of_scope: Named reactions beyond syllabus (Wittig, Baeyer-Villiger in detail)
Detailed NMR and IR spectral analysis for identification

concepts.concept_name: Classification, nomenclature, preparation, and physical properties of amines
Chemical properties: basicity, alkylation, acylation, and carbylamine reaction
Diazonium salts: preparation, coupling reactions, and synthetic applications

in_scope: Classification: primary, secondary, tertiary amines and their nomenclature
Preparation: reduction of nitro compounds, ammonolysis of halides, Gabriel phthalimide synthesis, Hoffmann bromamide degradation
Physical properties: hydrogen bonding and boiling points
Basicity of amines: comparison of aliphatic and aromatic amines
Chemical reactions: alkylation, acylation, carbylamine reaction, reaction with nitrous acid
Distinction between primary, secondary, and tertiary amines
Diazonium salts: preparation (Sandmeyer, Balz-Schiemann reactions), coupling reactions with phenols and amines
Importance of diazonium salts in synthesis of aromatic compounds
out_of_scope: Amino acid and protein chemistry (covered under Biomolecules)
Quaternary ammonium salts and phase transfer catalysis
Advanced mechanistic organic chemistry of nitrogen compounds

concepts.concept_name: Carbohydrates: classification, glucose and fructose structure, and glycosidic bond
Proteins: amino acids, peptide bond, primary to quaternary structure, and denaturation
Nucleic acids: DNA and RNA structure, nucleotides, and biological functions
Enzymes and vitamins: classification and functions

in_scope: Carbohydrates: monosaccharides (glucose, fructose), disaccharides (sucrose, maltose, lactose), polysaccharides (starch, cellulose, glycogen)
Open chain and cyclic structures of glucose and fructose
Proteins: amino acids, zwitterion, peptide bond, polypeptides
Primary, secondary, tertiary, quaternary structure of proteins
Denaturation of proteins
Enzymes: characteristics, mechanism of action, specificity
Vitamins: classification (water-soluble and fat-soluble), deficiency diseases
Nucleic acids: nucleosides, nucleotides, DNA double helix, RNA types
Biological functions of DNA and RNA
out_of_scope: Biochemical pathways (glycolysis, Krebs cycle) in detail
Genetic code and molecular biology techniques

concepts.concept_name: Classification of polymers and polymerization methods (addition, condensation)
Important polymers: polyethylene, nylon, bakelite, rubber, and biodegradable polymers
Molecular mass of polymers: number average and weight average

in_scope: Classification based on source (natural, synthetic, semi-synthetic)
Classification based on structure (linear, branched, cross-linked)
Classification based on polymerization: addition (chain growth) and condensation (step growth)
Copolymerization: concept and examples
Important polymers: polyethylene (LDPE, HDPE), polypropylene, PVC, polystyrene, teflon
Nylon-6, Nylon-6,6, polyesters (Dacron/Terylene), bakelite
Rubber: natural rubber, vulcanization, synthetic rubbers (Buna-S, Buna-N, neoprene)
Biodegradable polymers: PHBV, Nylon-2-nylon-6
Molecular mass: number average and weight average, polydispersity index
out_of_scope: Polymer physics and advanced characterisation techniques (GPC, DLS)
Industrial polymer processing and manufacturing technology
Polymer recycling technology in engineering detail

concepts.concept_name: Drugs and pharmaceuticals: classification, therapeutic action, and drug-target interaction
Chemicals in food: artificial sweeteners, preservatives, and antioxidants
Cleansing agents: soaps, synthetic detergents, and their mechanism of action

in_scope: Drugs and their classification: analgesics, tranquilizers, antiseptics, disinfectants, antimicrobials, antifertility drugs, antacids, antihistamines
Drug-target interaction: enzymes and receptors
Therapeutic action of common drugs
Chemicals in food: artificial sweeteners (aspartame, saccharin), food preservatives (sodium benzoate, sorbic acid)
Antioxidants in food: BHA, BHT
Soaps: saponification, micelle formation, cleaning action
Synthetic detergents: anionic, cationic, non-ionic types
Difference between soaps and detergents
out_of_scope: Clinical trials and drug regulatory processes
Detailed organic synthesis of pharmaceutical compounds
Cosmetic chemistry formulation and surfactant science in depth
